text.value: Observe how the CHP concludes the HH visit and communicates the next steps.
Communicate your findings to the CHP and indicate next steps
Observe how the CHP takes history, classifies the diarrhoea, gives treatment and referral instructions.
None cannot be selected with any other option!
What areas did the CHP have challenges on?
Encourage the client to make an informed choice and retain or take up an FP method
Used the CHP job aid to educate on modern FP methods (Definition, benefits, how it prevents pregnancy, possible side effects, risk factors for eligibility)
Observe how the CHP Educates and Counsels women on FP methods.
None cannot be selected with any other option!
What areas did the CHP have challenges on (F.P counselling/Health Education)?
Checks for key health issues in the homestead eg latrine use, hygiene
Ensures to confirm and update current contact address (phone number) of that household
Observe how the CHP conducts the Household visit
None cannot be selected with any other option!
Select areas they have challenges on
Correctly checked the MCH handbook against the KEPI schedule as per age
Education on expected adverse events and action to take following adverse effects
Observe how the CHP interrogates the MCH booklet and educates the mother/caregiver.
None cannot be selected with any other option!
What areas did the CHP have challenges on?
Activated uniject (mixing the solution holding the port,activate facing upwards)
Disposes waste timely - when sharp bottle 3/4 or once every month at branch or nearest link facility
Had all the required waste management supplies - Sharp bottle, Liner bags (yellow)
Injecting subcutaneously at ninety degrees on the thigh, stomach or upper arm
Observe how the CHP handles waste and use of PPEs.
None cannot be selected with any other option!
What areas did the CHP have challenges on?
Putting the correct amount of blood
Putting the required amount of buffer
Observe how the CHP takes history, decision for testing, testing procedure, result interpretation, decision for treatment and referral instructions.
None cannot be selected with any other option!
What areas did the CHP have challenges on?
**Newborn Visit (PNC Mother and Newborn Visit)**
Ask or check for newborn danger signs
Observe how the CHP interrogates the MCH booklet and educates on PNC and Newborn danger signs and importance of PNC clinic attendance, Good nutrition and Exclusive breastfeeding.
None cannot be selected with any other option!
In which areas did the CHP have challenges on?
Observe how the CHP is taking MUAC and intepreting, Oedema and 24 hr recall.
None cannot be selected with any other option!
What areas did the CHP have challenges on?
Observe how the CHP takes history and counts breaths and interpretes the diagnosis.
None cannot be selected with any other option!
What areas did the CHP have challenges on?
Educate on danger signs and risk factors
Observe how the CHP interrogates the MCH booklet and educates on ANC danger signs and importance of ANC clinic attendance, Good nutrition, and Individual Birth Plan.
None cannot be selected with any other option!
In which areas did the CHP have challenges on?
Education on the importance of a refusal disposal
Education and sensitization about the importance of use of latrines
Observe how the CHP talks about the importance of the use of a latrine, proper handwashing facilities, use of safe water, water treatment and use of a refuse disposal pit.
None cannot be selected with any other option!
What areas did the CHP have challenges on?
Does the CHP have all their tools of work (e.g. Uniform, commodities, Charged phone, thermometer, MUAC tape)?
Does the CHP have proper personal protective equipment (masks, gloves, soap, surgical spirit, cotton wool)?
The CHP was last visited on
Which personal protective equipment does the CHP lack?
Which tool does the CHP lack?
None cannot be selected with any other option!
Which essential medicine does the CHP lack?
Does the CHP have all the essential medicines?
**Remind the CHP to request for the commodities**

Ask or check for newborn danger signs

Checks for key health issues in the homestead eg latrine use, hygiene

Disposes waste timely - when sharp bottle 3/4 or once every month at branch or nearest link facility
Educate on danger signs and risk factors

Date cannot be in the past and more than two months into the future.

bind.calculate: if(selected( /chv_supervision/group_visit/visit , 'assessment'), round((number( /chv_supervision/calc_pneumonia_score ) + number( /chv_supervision/calc_malaria_score ) + number( /chv_supervision/calc_diarrhea_score ) + number( /chv_supervision/calc_nutrition_score ) + number( /chv_supervision/calc_immunization_score ) + number( /chv_supervision/calc_pregnancy_home_visit_score ) + number( /chv_supervision/calc_newborn_visit_score ) + number( /chv_supervision/calc_family_planning_score ) + number( /chv_supervision/calc_infection_prevention_control_score ) + number( /chv_supervision/calc_wash_score )) * 100 div /chv_supervision/calc_assessment_denominator , 2), '')

number( /chv_supervision/calc_pneumonia_denominator ) + number( /chv_supervision/calc_malaria_denominator ) + number( /chv_supervision/calc_diarrhea_denominator ) + number( /chv_supervision/calc_nutrition_denominator ) + number( /chv_supervision/calc_immunization_denominator ) + number( /chv_supervision/calc_pregnancy_home_visit_denominator ) + number( /chv_supervision/calc_newborn_visit_denominator ) + number( /chv_supervision/calc_family_planning_denominator ) + number( /chv_supervision/calc_infection_prevention_control_denominator ) + number( /chv_supervision/calc_wash_denominator )
